channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green electricity cabinet has the door open with the wires exposed, 26th February
item.description:
There is a green electricity cabinet which has the door open and the cables exposed. This needs to be assessed and made safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Baylis Road, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed electrical cables - potentially for the traffic lights!, 26th February
item.description:
There is an electrical box outside ‘Lambeth North’ station that has exposed cables, with the protection cover removed. This needs to be assessed and made safe. This could be for the traffic lights!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kennington Road, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In traffic island between Greencroft gardens and goldhurst gardens, 26th February
item.description:
The street lights in the traffic island don’t light up at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Goldhurst Terrace, South Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Waste Collection Laziness, 26th February
item.description:
Some of the waste in the photo had been displaced from one of the new recycling bags prior to today’s collection. Upon returning this evening it is evident that the bags, food waste bins and general waste has been removed yet staff feel it’s ok to just leave this. This is not acceptable, anti social and does nothing to keep our streets clean.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchelsea Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light outside 4/6 Lodge Road nut working, 26th February
item.description:
Street Light asset No. L 38 1 out side Nos 4 & 6 Lodge Road BR1 3ND remains off all night. It's been off for several days now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Road, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car park Avonhurst as usual, 26th February

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Abandoned car, 26th February
item.description:
Over a year this car has been sitting here parked.It has been graffiti with the word ‘Go’.This is among a few cars which are yet to be removed by the council.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnfield Gardens, Plumstead

item.description:

item.title: Pot holes -, 26th February
item.description:
I reported numerous potholes on this stretch of road, you filled in two, but left the others for cyclists to crash into. How about you fill them all. I count maybe six of seven more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trinity Gardens, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 26th February
item.description:
Car has been abandoned for over 8 months now.This is also next to two other abandoned cars.Please have these removed as this is drawing in anti social behaviour and reducing car parking spaces for member who live in the community

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnfield Gardens, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car dumped, 26th February
item.description:
Car has been dumped here for a few months now.No one has moved this.For the safety of our community please have this car removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnfield Gardens, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human Faeces (again) and fly tipping, 26th February
item.description:
Reoccurring human faeces in the alley way entrance to homes. This is a daily occurrence. Bonus feature, fly tipping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stanborough Passage, Hackney, London

item.title: Car has been dumped and sitting there for 8 months now, 26th February
item.description:
This car has been sitting there unmoved for a while now.It even has paint graffitied NO.I have seen a few people looking in the car and is slowly become a spot for antisocial behaviour.For the safety of our community please have this car removed!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnfield Gardens, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree outside 50 and 52 Holly Road, 26th February
item.description:
This tree has been damaged by, and caused damage to, vehicles parking in the road. The branches hit the windows of number 50 and hit the cars parking on the driveway of number 52. The low branches cause issues for pedestrians and the disabled resident of no.52 having to duck under. The issues are worse in spring/summer when there are leaves on the branches.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holly Road, Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another fly tip, again !, 26th February
item.description:
Yet again we have another fly tip at the end of Brook Lane. For decades people have dumped their rubbish in this same spot. Over and over and over again! Yet Bromley council refuse to address the problem with any proper deterrents. Start prosecuting people and stop wasting council tax money by sending Veolia out to clear the rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Lane, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped boxes of paint, 26th February
item.description:
Clear pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wansey Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diversion road sign left behind by workers, 26th February
item.description:
There was a road closure on Vanbrugh Hill on 23/02/2026 and the workers left behind a Diversion road sign outside 42 Vanbrugh Hill.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vanbrugh Hill, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet
